data.title: France (Bourbon)
data.text:
The headship of the Royal House of France is an interesting question. Leaving aside the dilemma caused by the Bonaparte claimant, who is clearly an heir to hereditary monarchs of two separate French Empires, the question of who is heir to the claim of the House of Capet, which ruled France for half the Christian era, is the subject of great dispute.

Probably the majority of French monarchists support the claims of the Orléanist line, headed by Henri, Comte de Paris, who has assumed the title "Duc de France". He is clearly the heir of Louis Philippe, King of the French, who ruled from 1830 to 1848. He is also the heir to the legitimist line of the House of Capet if the renunciation of King Felipe V of Spain to the French throne was valid. Eminent and learned scholars have argued that no such resignation was valid and that thus King Felipe's heir male inherited the Legitimist claim on the death of Henri V, so long, at least, as the claim is not united to another throne. The heir male of King Felipe is Don Luis Alfonso de Borbón.

Since reasonable persons can make valid arguments in favor of either claimant, both will be presented here in this article. Furthermore, if Luis Alfonso is entitled to be considered a French dynast, then so are all the legitimate male-line descendants of King Felipe, and, indeed, of Hugues Capet (e.g., the Seville, Roccaguglielma, Galliera, and Infant Gabriel lines). For other apparent dynasts of the House of France, then, see the articles on Spain, Two Sicilies, Parma, Brazil and Luxemburg.

Historically, no such title existed as "Prince of France". The members of the Orléanist branch who are not products of morganatic marriages have been accorded the title of Prince[ss] d'Orléans, Royal Highness, unless other titles are shown and the children of the head and the heir apparent of that line have now been accorded the title Prince[ss] of France, Royal Highness.

King LOUIS XIII of France was b.Fontainebleau 27 Sep 1601 and succeeded his father, King Henri IV as king 14 May 1610; he reigned until his death at St-Germain-en-Laye 14 May 1643, and was bur at St.Denis; he m.at Bordeaux 24 Nov 1615 Anna (Valladolid 22 Sep 1601-Louvre 20 Jan 1666; bur St.Denis), dau of King Felipe III of Spain

1a) LOUIS XIV, King of France (St-Germain-en-Laye 5 Sep 1638-Versailles 1 Sep 1715; bur St.Denis); m.1st by proxy at Fuenterrabía 3 Jun 1660 and in person at St-Jean-de-Luz 9 Jun 1660 Maria Teresa (Madrid 20 Sep 1638-Versailles 30 Jul 1683; bur St.Denis), dau of King Felipe IV of Spain; m.2nd at Versailles ca 12 Jun 1684 Françoise d'Aubigné, cr 1688 Marquise de Maintenon et du Parc (Niort 27 Nov 1635-St.Cyr 15 Apr 1719; bur St.Cyr)

1b) Louis, Dauphin de Viennois (Fontainebleau 1 Nov 1661-Château de Meudon 14 Apr 1711; bur St.Denis); m.1st by proxy at Munich 28 Jan 1680 and in person at Châlons-sur-Marne 7 Mar 1680 Marie Anne (Munich 28 Nov 1660-Versailles 20 Apr 1690; bur St.Denis), dau of Elector Ferdinand of Bavaria; m.2nd 1691/5 Marie Émilie Joly de Choin (Bourg-en-Bresse 2 Aug 1670-Paris ca 13 Apr 1732)

1c) Louis, Dauphin de Viennois (Versailles 6 Aug 1682-Versailles 18 Feb 1712; bur St.Denis); m.by proxy at Turin on 15 Sep 1696 and in person at Versailles 7 Dec 1697 Marie Adélaïde (Turin 6 Dec 1685-Versailles 12 Feb 1712; bur St.Denis), dau of Duke Vittorio Amedeo II of Savoy, later king of Sicily and Sardinia

1d) Louis Duc de Bretagne (Versailles25 Jun 1704-Versailles13 Apr 1705; bur St.Denis)

2d) Louis, Dauphin de Viennois (Versailles8 Jan 1707-Versailles8 Mar 1712; bur St.Denis)

3d) LOUIS XV, King of France (Versailles15 Feb 1710-Versailles10 May 1774; bur St.Denis); m.by proxy at Strasbourg15 Aug 1725 and in person at Fontainebleau5 Sep 1725 Marie (Poznan23 Jun 1703-Versailles24 Jun 1768; bur St.Denis), dau of Stanislaw Lesczynski, King of Poland, later Duke of Lorraine

1e) Louise Élisabeth (Versailles 14 Aug 1727-Versailles 6 Dec 1759; bur St.Denis); m.by proxy at Versailles 26 Aug 1739 and in person at Alcalá de Henares 25 Oct 1739 Filippo Inft of Spain, Duke of Parma, Piacenza and Guastalla (Madrid 15 Mar 1720-Alessandria 18 Jul 1765)

2e) Anne Henriette (Versailles14 Aug 1727-Versailles10 Feb 1752; bur St.Denis)

3e) Marie Louise (Versailles28 Jul 1728-Versailles19 Feb 1733; bur St.Denis)

4e) Louis Ferdinand, Dauphin de Viennois (Versailles 4 Sep 1729-Fontainebleau 20 Dec 1765; bur Sens Cathedral); m.1st by proxy at Madrid 18 Dec 1744 and in person at Versailles 23 Feb 1745 Maria Teresa (Madrid 11 Jun 1726-Versailles 22 Jul 1746; bur St.Denis), dau of King Felipe V of Spain; m.2nd by proxy at Dresden 10 Jan 1747 and in person at Versailles 9 Feb 1747 Josepha (Dresden 4 Nov 1731-Versailles 13 Mar 1767; bur Sens Cathedral), dau of Elector Friedrich August III of Saxony, King of Poland

1f) Marie Thérèse (Versailles19 Jul 1746-Versailles27 Apr 1748; bur St.Denis)

2f) Marie Zéphyrine (Versailles26 Aug 1750-Versailles2 Sep 1755; bur St.Denis)

3f) Louis Joseph Xavier Duc de Bourgogne (Versailles13 Sep 1751-Versailles22 Mar 1761; bur St.Denis)

4f) Xavier Marie Joseph Duc d'Aquitaine (Versailles8 Sep 1753-Versailles22 Feb 1754; bur St.Denis)

5f) LOUIS XVI Auguste, King of France (Versailles 23 Aug 1754-guillotined at Paris 21 Jan 1793; bur Cemetery of the Madeleine, then St.Denis); m.by proxy at Vienna 18 Apr 1770 and in person at Versailles 16 May 1770 Marie Antonie, Archduchess of Austria (Marie Antoinette) (Vienna 2 Nov 1755-guillotined at Paris 16 Oct 1793; bur Cemetery of the Madeleine, later St.Denis), dau of Emperor Franz I

1g) Marie Thérèse Charlotte, Cts de Marnes (Versailles 19 Dec 1778-Schloß Frohsdorf 19 Oct 1851; bur Castagnavizza); m.Mitau, Courland10 Jun 1799 Louis (King Louis XIX), Duc d'Angouleme (below)

2g) Louis Joseph Xavier François, Dauphin de Viennois (Versailles22 Oct 1781-Château de Meudon 4 Jun 1789; bur St.Denis)

3g) LOUIS XVII Charles, King of France [so recognized, though he never reigned] (Versailles27 Mar 1785-Paris8 Jun 1795; bur St.Marguerite, Paris)

4g) Marie Sophie Hélène Béatrice (Versailles9 Jul 1786-Versailles19 Jun 1787; bur St.Denis)

6f) LOUIS XVIII Stanislav Xavier, King of France, regained the throne 1814 until the return of Napoléon, and then recovered it again after Waterloo (Versailles 17 Nov 1755-Paris 16 Sep 1824; bur St.Denis); m.by proxy at Turin 21 Apr 1771 and in person at Versailles 14 May 1771 Pss Joséphine of Savoy (Turin 2 Sep 1753-Hartwell Castle 13 Nov 1810; bur Westmisnter Abbey, then Cagliari), dau of King Vittorio Amedeo III of Sardinia

7f) CHARLES X Philippe, King of France, was forced to abdicate 2 Aug 1830 (Versailles 9 Oct 1757-Görz 6 Nov 1836; bur Castagnavizza, nr Görz); m.by proxy at Moncalieri 24 Oct 1773 and in person at Versailles 16 Nov 1773 (separated 1789) Pss Maria Teresa of Savoy (Turin 31 Jan 1756-Graz 2 Jun 1805; bur Graz), dau of King Vittorio Amedeo III of Sardinia

1g) LOUIS XIX Antoine, King of France, Duc d'Angoulême, Dauphin de Viennois, he was king momentarily immediately after the abdication of his father until, moments later, he abdicated in favor of his nephew, Henri; (Versailles 6 Aug 1775-Görz 3 Jun 1844; bur Castagavizza); m.Mitau, Courland 10 Jun 1799 Marie Thérèse of France (above)

2g) Sophie (Versailles5 Aug 1776-Versailles5 Dec 1783; bur St.Denis)

3g) Charles Ferdinand, Duc de Berry (Versailles 24 Jan 1778-murdered at Paris 14 Feb 1820; bur St.Denis); m.by proxy at Naples 24 Apr 1816 and in person at Notre-Dame, Paris 17 Jun 1816 Maria Carolina Pss of Bourbon-Two Sicilies (Naples 5 Nov 1798-Schloß Brunnsee 17 Apr 1870); there is an unsubstantiated rumor that the Duc de Berry married one Amy Brown, by whom he did in fact have issue

1h) Louise Isabelle (Paris 13 Jul 1817-Paris 14 Jul 1817)

2h) Louis, b.and d.Paris 13 Sep 1818

3h) Louise Marie Thérèse (Paris 21 Sep 1819-Venice 1 Feb 1864); m.Frohsdorf 10 Nov 1845 Duke Carlo III of Parma, Pr of Bourbon (Lucca 14 Jan 1823-Parma 27 Mar 1854)

4h) HENRI V Charles Ferdinand Marie Dieudonné Duc de Bordeaux, Cte de Chambord, he succeeded his uncle and grandfather on 2 Aug 1830 but fled the country 18 Aug 1830 (Tuileries 29 Sep 1820-Schloß Frohsdorf 24 Aug 1883; bur Castagnavizza); m.by proxy at Modena 7 Nov 1846 and in person at Bruck an der Mur 16 Nov 1846 Marie Therese Archdss of Austria, Pss of Modena (Modena 14 Jul 1817-Görz 25 Mar 1886; bur Castagnavizza)

5h) [by Amy Brown] Charlotte Marie Augustine, Cts d'Issoudun (London 13 Jul 1808-Turin 13 Jul 1886); m.Paris 8 Oct 1823 Ferdinand Pr de Faucigny-Lucinge, Pr de Lucinge (Versailles 8 Sep 1789-Paris 18 Mar 1866)

6h) [by Amy Brown] Louise Marie Charlotte, Cts de Vierzon (London 29 Dec 1809-Château de la Contrie 26 Dec 1891); m.Paris 16 Jun 1827 Athanase Charles Marin de Charette de la Contrie (La Trémissinière 14 Jan 1796-château de La Contrie 16 Mar 1848)

7h) [by Eugénie-Virginie Oreille (Paris 8 Aug 1795-Paris Oct 1875)] Charles Louis Auguste Oreille de Carrière (Paris 4 Mar 1815-Paris 30 Aug 1858); m.in Austria, Elisabeth Jugan (Tarnopol 1821-Paris 11 Jan 1890)

8h) [Eugénie-Virginie Oreille] Ferdinand Oreille de Carrière (Paris 10 Oct 1820-Neuilly 27 Dec 1876); m.Neuilly 30 Jan 1860 Louise Eugénie Ancelle (Neuilly 24 Jun 1833-Paris 14 Apr 1900)

9h) [by Marie Sophie de La Roche (Brussel 27 Jun 1795 Versailles 19 Aug 1883)] Charles Ferdinand Joseph “cte" de la Roche (Brussel 24 Sep 1817 Gratz, Styria 24 Dec 1908); m.Gratz 24 May 1849 Claudine Gabrielle Claire de Bachet (de Méziriac) (1807/14 Gratz 17 Apr 1870)

10h) [by Marie Sophie de La Roche] Charles Ferdinand de La Roche (Paris 30 Mar 1820 Paris 12 Jan 1901); m.Limeil Brévannes,Val de Marne 2 Apr 1840 Sophie Julie Fidèle Dolé (Oulchy le Château, Aisne 20 Apr 1817-Paris 7 Mar 1904)

11h) [by Louise Mélanie Thirifoq (Paris 19 Sep 1802 Paris 29 Oct 1887)] Louise Charlotte Antoinette Aglaé “Caroline" Thirifoq (Paris 15 Oct 1819-Paris 25 May 1843); m.Paris 24 Apr 1839 Jean Charles Gaston Charron Duportail "de Charron cte du Portail" (Malmédy 28 Aug 1805 Versailles 10 Jun 1855)

4g) Marie Thérèse (Versailles6 Jan 1783-Choisy-le-Roi22 Jun 1783; bur St.Denis)

8f) Marie Adélaïde Clotilde Xavière (Versailles 23 Sep 1759-Naples 7 Mar 1802); m.by proxy at Versailles21 Aug 1775 and in person at Chambéry 6 Sep 1775 King Carlo Emanuele IV of Sardinia (Turin 24 May 1751-Rome 6 Oct 1819)

9f) Elizabeth Philippine Marie Hélène (Versailles3 May 1764-guillotined at Paris10 May 1794; bur Monceau)

5e) Philippe Louis, Duc d'Anjou (Versailles30 Aug 1730-Versailles7 Apr 1733; bur St.Denis)

6e) Marie Adélaïde (Versailles 23 Mar 1732-Trieste 27 Feb 1800; bur Trieste, then St.Denis)

7e) Victoire Louise Marie Thérèse (Versailles11 May 1733-Trieste7 Jun 1799; bur Trieste, then St.Denis)

8e) Sophie Philippine Élisabeth Justine (Versailles27 Jul 1734-Versailles3 Mar 1782; bur St.Denis)

9e) Thérèse Félicité (Versailles16 May 1736-Fontevrault28 Sep 1744; bur Fontevrault, then St.Denis)

10e) Louise Marie (Versailles15 Jul 1737-St.Denis23 Dec 1787; bur St.Denis)

2c) Philippe Duc d'Anjou, who became King Felipe V of Spain [see Spain]

........................(for intervening generations, see Spain)

2j) Jaime Luitpold Isabelino Enrique Alejandro Alberto Alfonso Victor Acacio Pedro Pablo Maria Infant of Spain, Duque de Segovia (San Ildefonso 23 Jun 1908-St.Gallen 20 Mar 1975); m.1st Rome 4 Mar 1935 (div 1947) Emanuela de Dampierre (Rome 8 Nov 1913-Rome 3 May 2012); m.2nd (civ) Innsbruck 3 Sep 1949 Charlotte Tiedemann (Königsberg 2 Jan 1919-Berlin 3 Jul 1979); in 1933 Don Jaime renounced his rights to the Spanish throne, but on the death of his father he became the senior legitimate heir male of the House of Capet, and thus in the opinion of some scholars de jure King of France, and he became known as Duc d'Anjou

1k) Don Alfonso Jaime Marcelino Manuel Victor Maria de Borbón y Dampierre, Duque de Cádiz, Duc d'Anjou; he was granted the style of Royal Highness in Spain in 1972; b.Rome 20 Apr 1936, k.in a skiing accident at Beaver Creek, Colorado 30 Jan 1989; m.Madrid 8 Mar 1972 (div 1982, rel annulled 1986) Maria del Carmen Martínez-Bordiu y Franco (b.Madrid 26 Feb 1951)

1l) Don Francisco Alfonso Jaime Cristobal Victor José Gonzalo Cecilio de Borbón y Martinez-Bordiu, Duc de Bourbon (Madrid 22 Nov 1972-Pamplona 7 Feb 1984)

2l) Don Luis Alfonso Gonzalo Victor Manuel Marco de Borbón y Martínez-Bordiu, Duc d'Anjou et de Bourbon, b.Madrid 25 Apr 1974; m.Caracas 5 Nov 2004 (rel) La Romana, Dominican Republic6 Nov 2004 Maria Margarita Vargas Santaella (b.Caracas 21 Oct 1983)

1m) Eugenia (b.Miami 5 Mar 2007)

2m) Luis, Duc de Bourgogne (b.New York28 May 2010)

3m) Alfonso, Duc de Berry (b.New York28 May 2010)

4m) Henri, Duc de Touraine (b.New York1 Feb 2019)

2k) Don Gonzalo Victor Alfonso José Bonifacio Antonio Maria y Todos los Santos de Borbón y Dampierre, Duc d'Aquitaine (Rome 5 Jun 1937-Lausanne 27 May 2000); m.1st (civ) Puerto Vallarta, Mexico 28 Jan 1983 (div 1983) Maria del Carmen Harto Monteallegre (b.Vallecas, Madrid 23 Apr 1947); m.2d (civ) Madrid (rel) Olmedo nr Valladolid 30 Jun 1984 (div 1989, rel annulled 1994) Maria de las Mercedes Licer y García (b.Valencia 15 Oct 1963); m.3d (civ) Genoa 12 Dec 1992 (rel) Rome 17 Sep 1995 Emanuela Pratolongo (b.Genoa 22 Mar 1960)

1l) [by Sandra Lee Landry, and recognized by her father as legitimate] Stephanie Michelle de Borbon, b.Miami 19 Jun 1968; m.West Palm Beach27 Jul 1995 Richard Carl McMasters (b.West Palm Beach25 Mar 1972)

........................(for intervening generations, see Spain)

3c) Charles Duc de Berry, d'Alençon et d'Angoulême, Cte de Ponthieu (Versailles 31 Aug 1686-Marly 4 May 1714; bur St.Denis); m.Versailles 6 Jul 1710 Louise Élisabeth d'Orléans (1695-1719; below)

1d) a daughter, called Mlle de Berry (b.and d.Fontainebleau 21 Jul 1711; bur St.Denis)

2d) Charles Duc d'Alençon (Versailles26 Mar 1713-Versailles16 Apr 1713; bur St.Denis)

3d) Marie Louise Élisabeth (Versailles16 Jun 1714-Versailles17 Jun 1714; bur St.Denis)

2b) Anne Élisabeth (Louvre 18 Nov 1662-Louvre30 Dec 1662; bur St.Denis)

3b) Marie Anne (Louvre 16 Nov 1664-Louvre26 Dec 1664; bur St.Denis)

4b) Marie Thérèse (St-Germain-en-Laye 2 Jan 1667-St-Germain-en-Laye1 Mar 1672; bur St.Denis)

5b) Philippe Charles Duc d'Anjou (St-Germain-en-Laye 5 Aug 1668-St-Germain-en-Laye10 Jul 1671; bur St.Denis)

6b) Louis François Duc d'Anjou (St-Germain-en-Laye 14 Jun 1672-St-Germain-en-Laye4 Nov 1672; bur St.Denis)

7b) [by NN, a gardener] a dau., bâtarde de Bourbon (1660- ); m.N de la Queue, a sentry

8b) [by Louise Françoise de La Baume-le-Blanc, Dss de La Vallière (château de La Vallière-en-Touraine 6 Aug 1644-Paris6 Jun 1710)] a son (b.1662, d.young)

9b) [by Louise Françoise de La Baume-le-Blanc, Dss de La Vallière] Charles (b.19 Dec 1663, d.young)

10b) [by Louise Françoise de La Baume-le-Blanc, Dss de La Vallière] Philippe (b.7 Jan 1665, d.young)

11b) [by Louise Françoise de La Baume-le-Blanc, Dss de La Vallière] Louis (Paris27 Dec 1665-Paris15 Jul 1666, bur there)

12b) [by Louise Françoise de La Baume-le-Blanc, Dss de La Vallière] Louis, legitimized 1669, Cte de Vermandois (St.Germain-en-Laye 2 Oct 1667-Courtrau18 Nov 1683, bur Arras)

13b) [by Louise Françoise de La Baume-le-Blanc, Dss de La Vallière] Marie Anne, "Mlle de Blois", legitimized 1667 and made a Pss of France and Dss de la Vallière, dit "la Grande Princesse de Conti" (Vincennes 2 Oct 1667-Paris 3 May 1739; bur St.Roch); m.St.Germain-en-Laye 16 Jan 1680 Louis Armand I, Pr de Conti (d.1685)

14b) [by Françoise Athenais de Rochechouart-Mortemart, Marquise de Montespan (1641-1707)] Louis Auguste, Duc du Maine et d'Aumale, sovereign Prince de Dombes, legitimized 1673 (St.Germain-en-Laye 31 Mar 1670-Château de Sceaux 14 May 1736; bur Sceaux); m.Versailles 19 Mar 1692 Pss Anne Louise de Condé (1676-1753)

1c) a dau (Versailles11 Sep 1694-Versailles26 Sep 1694, bur there)

2c) Louis Constantine, Pr de Dombes (Versailles27 Nov 1695-Versailles28 Sep 1698; bur Versailles)

3c) a dau (Versailles21 Dec 1697-Versailles22 Aug 1699, bur Aumale)

4c) Louis Auguste, Duc d'Aumale, Pr de Dombes (Versailles4 Mar 1700-Fontainebleau1 Oct 1755)

5c) Louis Charles, Pr de Dombes, Cte d'Eu (Château de Sceaux 15 Oct 1701-Château de Sceaux 13 Jul 1775; bur Sceaux)

6c) Charles, Duc d'Aumale (Versailles 30/31 Mar 1704-Sceaux 2/3 Sep 1708; bur Eu)

7c) Louise Françoise, "Mlle du Maine" (Versailles4 Dec 1707-Château d'Anet 19 Aug 1743)

15b) [by Françoise Athenais de Rochechouart-Mortemart, Marquise de Montespan] Louis César, Cte de Vexin, legitimized 1673 (Le Genitoy 20 Jun 1672-Paris10 Jan 1683)

16b) [by Françoise Athenais de Rochechouart-Mortemart, Marquise de Montespan] Louise Françoise, legitimized 1673 (Tournai 1 Jun 1673-Paris16 Jun 1743); m.Versailles 24 Jul 1685 Pr Louis III de Condé (d.1710)

17b) [by Françoise Athenais de Rochechouart-Mortemart, Marquise de Montespan] Françoise Marie, legitimized 1681 (Château de Maintenon 9 Feb 1677-Paris1 Feb 1749); m.Versailles 18 Feb 1692 Duc Philippe II d'Orleans (d.1723)

18b) [by Françoise Athenais de Rochechouart-Mortemart, Marquise de Montespan] Louis Alexandre, Duc de Penthièvre et de Rambouillet, etc, legitimized 1681 (Versailles6 Jun 1678-Rambouillet1 Dec 1737); m.Paris 22 Feb 1723 Marie Victoire Sophie de Noailles (6 May 1688-Paris30 Sep 1766)

1c) Louis Jean Marie, Duc de Penthièvre, de Rambouillet, d'Aumale et de Gisors, etc (Rambouillet 16 Nov 1725-Château de Bizy 4 Mar 1793); m.Versailles 29 Dec 1744 Teresa d'Este (Modena6 Oct 1726-Paris30 Apr 1754)

1d) Louis Marie (Versailles2 Jan 1746-d.young)

2d) Louis Alexandre, Pr de Lamballe (Paris6 Sep 1747-Château de Louveciennes 6 May 1768); m.by proxy at Turin17 Jan 1767 and in person at Nangis 31 Jan 1767 Pss Maria Teresa of Savoy (Turin8 Sep 1749-executed at Paris3 Sep 1792)

3d) Jean Marie, Duc de Châteauvilain (Paris17 Nov 1748-Paris19 May 1755)

4d) Vincent Marie Louis, Cte de Guingamp (Paris22 Jun 1750-Versailles14 Mar 1752)

5d) Marie Louise (Paris18 Oct 1751-Versailles 25/26 Sep 1753)

6d) Louise Marie Adélaide (Paris 13 Mar 1753-Château d'Ivry 23 Jun 1821); m.Versailles 5 Apr 1769 Duc Louis Philippe II d'Orleans (d.1793)

7d) Louis Marie Félicité (Paris 29 Apr 1754-Paris30 Apr 1754)

2c) [by Madeleine Aumont] Louis Alexandre de Sainte-Foy (b.1720, d.young)

3c) [by Madeleine Aumont] Philippe Auguste de Sainte-Foy, dit le Chevalier d'Arcq (Paris20 Jul 1721-Paris5 Feb 1795); m.Paris 11 Feb 1772 Marie Richard (d.1801)

1d) N Richard de Sainte-Foy [a dau] (14 Sep 1767-23 Jan 1795)

19b) [by Françoise Athenais de Rochechouart-Mortemart, Marquise de Montespan] a dau. (1669-1672)

20b) [by Françoise Athenais de Rochechouart-Mortemart, Marquise de Montespan] Louise Marie Anne, dit Mlle de Tours, legitimized 1676 (St.Germain-en-Laye 12 Nov 1674-Bourbon-l'Archambault15 Sep 1681, bur Souvigny)

213b) [by Marie Angelique de Scorailles, cr Dss de Fontanges (1661-28 Jun 1681)] a son (Port Royal7 Jan 1681-Port Royal 1681)

22b) [by Claude de Vin, dit Mlle des Oeillets (1637-Paris 18 May 1687)] Louise de Maisonblanche (1676-La Queue-les-Yvelines 12 Sep 1718, bur Galluis); m.Paris 17 Apr 1696 Bernard de Prez, Baron de La Queue (d.La Queue-les-Yvelines 4 Apr 1740)

2a) Philippe Duc d'Orléans (St-Germain-en-Laye 21 Sep 1640-St.Cloud 9 Jun 1701; bur St.Denis); m.1st Paris 31 Mar 1661 Henriette Anne Pss of England and Scotland (Bedford House, Exeter 16 Jun 1644-St.Cloud 30 Jun 1670; bur St.Denis), dau of King Charles I; m.2nd by proxy at Metz 16 Nov 1671 and in person at Châlons 21 Nov 1671 Elisabeth Charlotte Pfgfn von Simmern (Heidelberg 27 May 1652-St.Cloud 8 Dec 1722; bur St.Denis), dau of Karl Ludwig, Elector Palatine

1b) Marie Louise (Palais Royal 27 Mar 1662-Madrid12 Feb 1689); m.by proxy at Fontainebleau31 Aug 1679 and in person at Quintanapalla 18 Nov 1679 King Carlos II of Spain (Madrid6 Nov 1661-Madrid1 Nov 1700)

2b) Philippe Charles Duc de Valois (Fontainebleau16 Jul 1664-Palais Royal 8 Dec 1666; bur St.Denis)

3b) Anne Marie (St.Cloud 27 Aug 1669-Turin 26 Aug 1728); m.by proxy at Palais Royal 10 Apr 1684 and in person at Chambéry 6 May 1684 Vittorio Amedeo II, King of Sardinia, Duke of Savoy (Turin 14 May 1666-Moncalieri 31 Oct 1732)

4b) Alexandre Louis Duc de Valois (St.Cloud 2 Jun 1673-Palais Royal 16 Mar 1676; bur St.Denis)

5b) Philippe Duc d'Orléans, Regent of France 1715-1723 (St.Cloud 2 Aug 1674-Versailles 2 Dec 1723; bur St.Denis); m.Versailles 18 Feb 1692 Françoise Marie de Bourbon, called Mlle de Blois, legitimated daughter of King Louis XIV (Château de Maintenon 4 May 1677-Paris 1 Feb 1749)

1c) a daughter, called Mlle de Valois (Marly 17 Dec 1693-Palais Royal 17 Oct 1694; bur Val-de-Grace)

2c) Marie Louise Élisabeth (Versailles20 Aug 1695-Château de la Muette 21 Jul 1719; bur St.Denis); m.1st Versailles6 Jul 1710 Charles Duc de Berry (1686-1714; above); m.2nd 1716 Armand d'Aydic Cte de Rion (Versailles 1692-Paris 26 Mar 1741)

3c) Louise Adélaïde, Abbess of Chelles 1717-34, Abbess of Val-de-Grace 1722 (Versailles13 Aug 1698-Priory of St.Madeleine du Trainel, Paris19 Feb 1743; bur there)

4c) Charlotte Aglaé (Paris22 Oct 1700-Modena19 Jan 1761); m.by proxy at the Tuileries 12 Feb 1720 and in person at Modena21 Jun 1720 Duke Francesco III of Modena (Modena2 Jul 1698-Varese22 Feb 1780)

5c) Louis, Duc d'Orléans (Versailles4 Aug 1703-Paris4 Feb 1752; bur Val-de-Grace); m.by proxy at Rastatt 18 Jun 1724 and in person at Sarry 13 Jul 1724 Auguste Pss of Baden-Baden (Aschaffenburg10 Nov 1704-Palais Royal 8 Aug 1726; bur Val-de-Grace)

1d) Louis Philippe, Duc d'Orléans (Versailles12 May 1725-Château de Sainte-Assise-en-Brie18 Nov 1785; bur St.Pon, nr Melun); m.1st Versailles17 Dec 1743 Pss Louise Henriette de Conti (Paris20 Jan 1726-Paris9 Feb 1759); m.2nd Paris23 Apr 1773 Charlotte Jeanne Béraud de la Haye (Paris 4 Oct 1738-Paris 5 Feb 1806; bur St.Pon)

1e) a daughter, called Mlle de Chartres (13 Jul 1745-St.Cloud14 Dec 1745)

2e) Louis Philippe Joseph Duc d'Orléans (St.Cloud 13 Apr 1747-guillotined at Paris6 Nov 1793); m.Versailles 5 Apr 1769 Louise Marie Adélaïde de Bourbon-Penthièvre (Paris 13 Mar 1753-Ivry-sur-Seine 23 Jun 1821; bur Dreux)

1f) a daughter, called Mlle de Chartres (b.and d.10 Oct 1771)

2f) Louis Philippe, Duc d'Orléans, assumed the throne as LOUIS PHILIPPE, King of the French, after his distant cousin, King Charles X, was ousted in 1830; he himself was ousted during the revolutions of 1848; he was b.at the Palais Royal 6 Oct 1773 and d.at Claremont House, Surrey 26 Aug 1850; bur Weybridge, then Dreux; m.at Palermo 25 Nov 1809 Maria Amelia Pss of Bourbon-Two Sicilies (Caserta 26 Apr 1782-Claremont House 24 Mar 1866; bur Weybridge, then Dreux)

1g) Ferdinand Philippe Louis Charles Henri Rosolin, Duc d'Orléans (Palermo 3 Sep 1810-Sablonville 13 Jul 1842; bur Dreux); m.Fontainebleau 30 May 1837 Hélène Dss of Mecklenburg-Schwerin (Ludwigslust 24 Jan 1814-Richmond, Surrey 18 May 1858; bur Weybridge, then Dreux)

1h) Louis Philippe Albert Cte de Paris (Palais de Tuileries 24 Aug 1838-Stowe House, Bucks 8 Sep 1894; bur Weybridge, then Dreux); m.Kingston-on-Thames 30 May 1864 Maria Isabella Infanta of Spain (Seville 21 Sep 1848-Villamanrique de la Condesa, Seville 23 Apr 1919)

1i) Marie Amélie Louise Hélène (York House 28 Sep 1865-Versailles 25 Oct 1951; bur Lisbon); m.Lisbon 22 May 1886 King Carlos I of Portugal (Lisbon 28 Sep 1863-Lisbon 1 Feb 1908)
